prompt:
Describe the purpose of a cover letter and explain its role in an application process. Provide examples of times when including a cover letter can help or hinder your chances of being selected for a position.
A cover letter is an introductory document that accompanies a resume when applying for a job. It serves as a formal introduction and provides context to the applicant’s reasons for seeking employment, their qualifications, and why they believe themselves to be a strong fit for the role. Cover letters can help or hinder one’s chances of being selected for a position depending on how well they are written and tailored to the specific job opening. When writing a cover letter, it is important to address any gaps in employment, explain unusual career paths, and provide additional information about skills and experiences not listed on your resume.
